# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) > text_width
            # If the current word is longer than the width, we need to wrap it.
            line = ""
            for part in split(word, ' ')[1:end-1]
                part_length = length(part) + 1 # Add 1 for the space after splitting.
                if (part_length + length(line)) > text_width
                    push!(lines, line)
                    line = part
                else
                    line *= " $part"
                end
            end
            push!(lines, line)
        else
            # The word fits within the width or is shorter than it.
            if length(line) > 0
                push!(lines, line)
                line = ""
            end
            line *= "$word"
        end
    end
    return lines
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer nec odio. Praesent libero. Sed cursus ante dapibus diam."
wrapped_lines = wrap_string(text)
println(join(wrapped_lines, "\n"))
```

This will output:

```
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer nec odio. Praesent libero. Sed cursus ante dapibus diam.
```
